name: Blue Monday: Painted Moon Issue #1 Page 1
description:
11x17" Ink on bristol.

"How Soon Is Now?"

Clover is dropped off by her dad so she can spend the night at Erin's house. Bleu is spending the night as well â€“ alas, she has already spirited off into the night and up into a tree outside Mr. Bishop's window (and has been there for the last two hours). Erin lays about nonchalantly in her lingerie, painting her nails. Clover won't allow this ridiculousness to keep going on...at least not tonight. Time to go extract the blue one out of the shrubbery!

Published by Oni Press, 2004.

*Additional images of page available upon request

name: Scooter Girl #3 COVER
description:
11x17" ink on bristol.

"Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow"

Ashton Archer is relentlessly going after Margaret Sheldon, irritating her to no end. Her brother, Drake, has been dragged into the middle of it all, very unwillingly. Ashton is the bane of both Margaret and Drake's existence right now, and there's no guarantee the pestering is going to end any time soon.

Published by Oni Press

*Additional images of page available upon request

name: Blue Monday: Painted Moon Issue #4 Page 5
description:
11x17" ink on bristol.

"I Confess"

Hurrah! Some yahoo pulled the fire alarm, so the kids are herded like cattle to go stand on the football field in orderly lines until the all-clear is given. But hey, at least they're out of class, right? That's Bleu's feeling, anyway. Unfortunately for Clover, that means the possibility of seeing Monkeyboy and Victor on the field, and worse, the idea of facing them after she planted a kiss on Monkeyboy at the bowlin' alley, a la GREASE 2 the night before, just to make Victor feel jealous and/or stupid (hopefully both). Not her best moment, it was pretty gross, hence gargling the BREF FRESHNA. It looks like Victor was affected, at least. Alan meanwhile glares at Bleu, who is oblivious as usual.

Published by Oni Press, 2004.

*Additional images of page available upon request

name: Scooter Girl #5 Page 7
description:
11x17" ink on bristol. 

Margaret takes Ashton to his DJ gig in record time, nearly mowing down several people and neighborhood pets (is that the rear end of Fat Freddy's Cat?) in the process. She laughs, he's mortified.
 
Published by Oni Press, 2004. 

*Additional images of page available upon request

name: COVER - Blue Monday: Painted Moon Issue 2 "Pictures of Lily"
description:
11x17" ink on bristol. 

Cover to the infamous "self discovery" episode featuring Bleu Finnegan and a mass of lilies as an ode to The Who!

Published through Oni Press, 2004. 4th collection in the Blue Monday series.
